page.title: 14SURROUNDING FARMLAND.
page.content: During the month of June the farmland surrounding Horndon on the Hill blazed brilliant yellow with flowers of the rape seed.The majority of fields seem to be growing either rape seed or barley.Other crops seen were potatoes and broad beans.The main field boundaries seem to be either ditches or hedges.Several well marked public footpaths also acted as field boundaries.Numerous bees were seen whilst walking through the rape field.At Horndon house farm twelve bee hives were seen.The bee keeper explained that he made honey and sold it at local shows for Â£1.00 a jar.
